channel.title: Product News
channel.description: Latest Internet product news headlines from Internet Product Watch and Internetnews.com.
channel.dc:creator: Daniel M. Ragle (dragle@internet.com)

item.title: Broadcom, Palm Looking a Little Blue in the Tooth
item.description: Palm will use Broadcom transceivers to beef up its personal area network (PAN) capabilities on its handhelds.

item.title: Openwave to Power Cox's Messaging
item.description: Cox chooses Openwave Email Mx messaging platform for use by Cox's 779,000 residential Internet subscribers.

item.title: MTV Announces Line of PCs
item.description: Bearing its logo, the hardware are designed for college dorm rooms but will appear near the end of the school year.

item.title: How Long Will the Chips be Down?
item.description: The semiconductor industry rebounds, it always does. Recent data, legislative action and a flurry of VC activity suggest that the current chip-dip may be easing.

item.title: Sprint Rolls Out Corporate Wireless E-mail at CES
item.description: Nation's fourth-largest wireless provider hopes eliminating synchronization issues will push sales of new service.

item.title: Microsoft Unveils Home Device Technology
item.description: Microsoft founder Bill Gates used his keynote address at the Consumer Electronics 2002 show to show a new set of Windows-based technologies, code-named "Mira" and "Freestyle."

item.title: TiVo Adds RealOne Media Player to its DVRs
item.description: With the agreement, TiVo customers may access tunes and other content from their DVRs, courtesy of RealNetworks' technology.

item.title: Loudeye, Audible Magic Woo the Future
item.description: Companies roll out digital music tracking and management solution for industry heavyweights at Future of Music Conference.

item.title: GridSim Releases Java-based Grid Computing Toolkit
item.description: An Australian grid research project team has released a Java-based software toolkit designed to support modeling and simulation of worldwide grids.

item.title: Apple Flat Out Wows Them At Macworld
item.description: Job's "digital hub" takes a new twist with the release of flat paneled iMac, a bigger iBook and launch of all new iPhoto.

item.title: Microsoft Gets Cozy with DVD Players
item.description: In its continuing quest to promote the Windows Media Audio (WMA) format, the Redmond, Wash. software giant announces at CES that two DVD players manufacturers will include support in their home entertainment gear.

item.title: Adobe Updates To Trump Flash
item.description: The San Jose, Calif.-based Web graphics company takes the "anything you can do, we can do better" approach with the latest GoLive and LiveMotion release.

item.title: HomeRF WLANS Advance, Retreat
item.description: Wireless home networking is about to arrive at the flash point in which its popularity will explode and most of those home networks will be 802.11b.

item.title: Macromedia to Infuse Casio with Flash Player
item.description: In doing combat with Adobe, Macromedia offers Flash Player for Casio's Pocket PC and other Windows CE-based PDAs.
